title: How to Add and Simplify Fractions

steps.title: Verify the fractions have the same denominator.
steps.content: Verify the fractions have the same denominator. A denominator is the number below the fraction bar. [1] X Research source If the fractions do not have the same denominator, you cannot use this method. For example, if you are calculating 2 4 + 1 4 {\displaystyle {\frac {2}{4}}+{\frac {1}{4}}} , you can note that both fractions have the same denominator: 4.

steps.title: Add the numerators.
steps.content: Add the numerators. A numerator is the number above the fraction bar. Add numerators the same way you would add integers. [2] X Research source For example, the numerators of 2 4 {\displaystyle {\frac {2}{4}}} and 1 4 {\displaystyle {\frac {1}{4}}} are 2 and 1, so you would calculate 2 + 1 = 3 {\displaystyle 2+1=3} . So, 3 is the numerator of your sum.

steps.title: Place the numerators’ sum over the denominator.
steps.content: Place the numerators’ sum over the denominator. Since both fractions you are adding have the same denominator, the denominator of their sum will also be the same. [3] X Research source For example, the sum of 2 4 + 1 4 {\displaystyle {\frac {2}{4}}+{\frac {1}{4}}} will have a denominator of 4: 2 4 + 1 4 = 3 4 {\displaystyle {\frac {2}{4}}+{\frac {1}{4}}={\frac {3}{4}}} .

steps.title: Verify the fractions have different denominators.
steps.content: Verify the fractions have different denominators. A denominator is the number below the fraction bar. [4] X Research source For example, if you are calculating 4 5 + 3 4 {\displaystyle {\frac {4}{5}}+{\frac {3}{4}}} , you can note that the fractions have different denominators: 5 and 4.

steps.title: List the first several multiples of the smaller denominator.
steps.content: List the first several multiples of the smaller denominator. A multiple is a number that another number equally divides into. You can also think of a multiple as the result of multiplying a number by a whole number. You are looking for the smallest multiple that the two denominators have in common. [5] X Research source For example, the smallest denominator in 4 5 + 3 4 {\displaystyle {\frac {4}{5}}+{\frac {3}{4}}} is 4. The first several multiples of 4 are 4, 8, 12, 16, and 20. The smallest of these multiples that 5 shares with 4 is 20. So, 20 is the least common multiple of the two denominators.

steps.title: Divide the first fraction’s denominator into the least common multiple.
steps.content: Divide the first fraction’s denominator into the least common multiple. The result will give you a factor of change. This factor tells you how much bigger the common multiple is than the denominator. [6] X Research source For example, if the least common multiple is 20, and the first fraction’s denominator is 5, you would calculate 20 5 = 4 {\displaystyle {\frac {20}{5}}=4} . That means 4 is the factor of change. The least common multiple is 4 times larger than the denominator.

steps.title: Multiply the numerator of the first fraction by the factor of change.
steps.content: Multiply the numerator of the first fraction by the factor of change. Doing this will keep the numerator and denominator of the equivalent fraction in proportion. [7] X Expert Source David Jia Academic Tutor Expert Interview. 7 January 2021. [8] X Research source For example, if the factor of change is 4, and the first fraction’s numerator is 4, you would calculate 4 × 4 = 16 {\displaystyle 4\times 4=16} .

steps.title: Write the first fraction’s equivalent fraction.
steps.content: Write the first fraction’s equivalent fraction. The numerator will be the product of the factor of change and the original fraction’s numerator. The denominator will be the least common multiple. For example, 4 5 = 16 20 {\displaystyle {\frac {4}{5}}={\frac {16}{20}}} .

steps.title: Divide the second fraction’s denominator into the least common multiple.
steps.content: Divide the second fraction’s denominator into the least common multiple. The result will give you a factor of change for the second fraction. This factor tells you how much bigger the common multiple is than the denominator. For example, if the least common multiple is 20, and the second fraction’s denominator is 4, you would calculate 20 4 = 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {20}{4}}=5} . That means 5 is the factor of change for the second fraction.

steps.title: Multiply the numerator of the second fraction by the factor of change.
steps.content: Multiply the numerator of the second fraction by the factor of change. This will give you the numerator of your equivalent fraction. [9] X Research source For example, if the factor of change is 5, and the second fraction’s numerator is 3, you would calculate 5 × 3 = 15 {\displaystyle 5\times 3=15} .

steps.title: Write the second fraction’s equivalent fraction.
steps.content: Write the second fraction’s equivalent fraction. The numerator will be the product of the factor of change and the original fraction’s numerator. The denominator will be the least common multiple. [10] X Research source For example, 3 4 = 15 20 {\displaystyle {\frac {3}{4}}={\frac {15}{20}}} .

steps.title: Add the numerators of the equivalent fractions.
steps.content: Add the numerators of the equivalent fractions. Since the equivalent fractions have the same denominator, you can add the numerators as you normally would. [11] X Research source For example, 16 + 15 = 31 {\displaystyle 16+15=31} .

steps.title: Place the sum of the numerators over the new denominator.
steps.content: Place the sum of the numerators over the new denominator. Make sure you use the common denominator of the equivalent fractions. [12] X Research source For example, 16 20 + 15 20 = 31 20 {\displaystyle {\frac {16}{20}}+{\frac {15}{20}}={\frac {31}{20}}} .

steps.title: Factor the numerator.
steps.content: Factor the numerator. You want to factor the numerator into all of its prime factors. Remember that a prime number is a number that is only divisible by 1 and itself. Rewrite the fraction showing this prime factorization in the numerator. [13] X Research source For example, if simplifying the fraction 24 90 {\displaystyle {\frac {24}{90}}} , you would calculate that 24 = 2 × 2 × 2 × 3 {\displaystyle 24=2\times 2\times 2\times 3} . So, rewrite the fraction as 2 × 2 × 2 × 3 90 {\displaystyle {\frac {2\times 2\times 2\times 3}{90}}}

steps.title: Factor the denominator.
steps.content: Factor the denominator. You also want to factor the denominator into its prime factors. Rewrite the fraction showing its prime factorization in the denominator. [14] X Research source For example, if simplifying the fraction 24 90 {\displaystyle {\frac {24}{90}}} , you would calculate that 90 = 2 × 3 × 3 × 5 {\displaystyle 90=2\times 3\times 3\times 5} . So, rewrite the fraction as 2 × 2 × 2 × 3 2 × 3 × 3 × 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {2\times 2\times 2\times 3}{2\times 3\times 3\times 5}}} .

steps.title: Cancel the factors common to the numerator and denominator.
steps.content: Cancel the factors common to the numerator and denominator. Remember that when a factor is common to the top and bottom of a fraction, it cancels to 1 1 {\displaystyle {\frac {1}{1}}} . This means you can eliminate these factors, since any number multiplied by 1 is itself. [15] X Research source For example, you can cancel out a 2 and a 3 in the numerator and denominator: 2 × 2 × 2 × 3 2 × 3 × 3 × 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {{\cancel {2\times }}2\times 2{\cancel {\times 3}}}{{\cancel {2\times }}{\cancel {3\times }}3\times 5}}} .

steps.title: Rewrite the fraction with the remaining factors.
steps.content: Rewrite the fraction with the remaining factors. You want to simplify the fraction so that it only includes the factors that did not cancel. If more than one factor remains in either the numerator or denominator, you need to multiply them together to get a single integer. The result will be your simplified fraction. [16] X Research source For example: 2 × 2 × 2 × 3 2 × 3 × 3 × 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {{\cancel {2\times }}2\times 2{\cancel {\times 3}}}{{\cancel {2\times }}{\cancel {3\times }}3\times 5}}} 2 × 2 3 × 5 {\displaystyle {\frac {2\times 2}{3\times 5}}} 4 15 {\displaystyle {\frac {4}{15}}} So, the fraction 24 90 {\displaystyle {\frac {24}{90}}} simplifies to 4 15 {\displaystyle {\frac {4}{15}}} .
